content: Please post your Troubleshooting Information. At the top right of the Thunderbird window, click the menu button â‰¡, then select Help > More Troubleshooting Information. Press the "Copy text to clipboard button" and paste the information into your reply.
creator: christ1

content:
The most simple (and easiest) way is to use the TB built-in CardDAV support. You'd need to create a new network calendar.

open a Calendar tab in Thunderbird File (Alt-F) - New - Calendar choose 'On the Network' give it a unique name, and provide you Gmail email address enter your Google account credentials when prompted, and give Thunderbird permissions to access your Google Calendar. Note, cookies need to be temporarily allowed in Thunderbird for this to work.

The new Google Calendar will show up in the left pane of the Calendar tab.
creator: christ1
